util.linalg

Class HouseholderReflection

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.linalg.HouseholderReflection

  • public class HouseholderReflection
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a householder reflection, a matrix of the form P = I - beta * v * vt for some column vector v and some scalar beta equal to 2/ (vt * v).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew Guillory gtg008g@mail.gatech.edu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HouseholderReflection(Vector x)
      Create a new householder reflection that reflects the given vector x into a column vector [r, 0, 0, ...] = P*x for some value r.
      HouseholderReflection(Vector v, double beta)
      Create a new householder reflection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyLeft(Matrix m, int ia, int ib, int ja, int jb)
      Apply the householder reflection to the sub matrix of the given matrix begining at row i, column j.
      void applyRight(Matrix m, int ia, int ib, int ja, int jb)
      Apply the householder reflection to the sub matrix of the given matrix begining at row i, column j.
      double getBeta()
      Get the scale factor
      Vector getV()
      Get the householder vector

      • HouseholderReflection

        public HouseholderReflection(Vector x)
        Create a new householder reflection that reflects the given vector x into a column vector [r, 0, 0, ...] = P*x for some value r.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • applyLeft

        public void applyLeft(Matrix m,
                      int ia,
                      int ib,
                      int ja,
                      int jb)
        Apply the householder reflection to the sub matrix of the given matrix begining at row i, column j. Sets A(i:m, j:n) = P * A(i:m, j:n)
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to apply the reflection to
        i - the starting row
        ib - the ending row
        ja - the starting column
        jb - the ending column

      • applyRight

        public void applyRight(Matrix m,
                       int ia,
                       int ib,
                       int ja,
                       int jb)
        Apply the householder reflection to the sub matrix of the given matrix begining at row i, column j. Sets A(i:m, j:n) = A(i:m, j:n) * P
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to apply the reflection to
        ia - the starting row
        ja - the starting column
        jb - the ending column
